meanings.definition: A vavasor is a feudal tenant holding directly from a baron.
meanings.sent1: The vavasors served the baron faithfully.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, vavasors played an important role in the feudal system.
meanings.sent3: The vavasors threw a grand feast to honor their baron.
meanings.sent4: The vavasors were the loyal subjects of the baron, like knights to a king.
meanings.sent5: The vavasors' loyalty to the baron was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Vavasors were a class of lesser nobility in medieval England.
meanings.sent1: The vavasors held a respected position in medieval society.
meanings.sent2: During the Middle Ages, vavasors had certain privileges as lesser nobility.
meanings.sent3: The vavasors organized a jousting tournament for entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The vavasors stood out in the crowd, their noble bearing unmistakable.
meanings.sent5: The vavasors' manor was a symbol of their status in society.
